Reviews.Title: Easy set up!  Just place and go!
Reviews.Author: Chris's mom
Reviews.Content: I have looked for an online type camera for over 2 years....tried some but could not get the right set up for my modem, etc. I'm not very computer savvy, find progamming routers over the top for me. Got this camera system on a gold box deal and I can't say enough about how easy it was to set up. I can access the cameras through my smartphone, get alerts when there is motion detected, and the picture is very good. I have several friends who have seen this and then got one for themselves. Why a camera system? I have lots of wildlife, want to see what's going by my door and also was looking for a system that could show me if it is snowing before I left for my 45 minute commute home. (Not uncommon to get 2-3 feet of snow here). An added benefit is the video library that vuezone maintains for my account.Although Vuezone does not say there are outdoor cameras, I have a motion detector camera outside, on a tree, with a little "roof" over it. Have had no problems with it... The first day I used it, I checked my smart phone, vuezone indicated there was motion on the camera, so I checked it. Scared the crap out of me.....I saw someone in a pink shirt at my back door, panicked for a bit, but then after I caught my breath, realized it was a video of me leaving for work that morning....too funny!Battery life is great also...I ordered extra batteries when I got the system, but have not had to replace them yet, and it's been over 1 month now. I would recommend this system to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Motion could use a little work
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and use.  There's a lag between the motion and recording start time.  I'll receive some alerts only to see that whoever activated the camera passed before it recorded them.  Great concept, looking forward to some improvements and the outside version.  VueZone is great about providing updates for their products, I'm sure this one will be addressed in future updates.

Reviews.Title: this little camera is great
Reviews.Author: KrazyK
Reviews.Content: I am using the cameras outside under the eaves of the house.They have been there unattended for 2 months and I have had no issues with anything. I can clearly see the areas I need to and think the entire system is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Torres
Reviews.Content: We took a two week vacation (drove from New York to Disney World).  We set up three of these cameras around the house.  It gave us much peace of mind to be able to view the inside of the house from the car, hotels etc.  Well worth the money.  There was minimal battery drain during the two weeks.  I highly recommend these.

Reviews.Title: Very Easy to Set Up, Could use More Features
Reviews.Author: Angelique
Reviews.Content: Was easy to set up and use.  The IPhone app is great - lets you view video, record, and turn on motion detection right on the IPhone.  Well worth it.  Thinking of getting a set for the vacation home.I would have given this camera 5 stars if you could schedule motion detection the same way you can schedule recording.  Having to remember to turn on motion detection before going to work and remembering to turn it off after coming home everyday certainly isn't foolproof.  Would be very easy for them to implement - scheduling recording already works great.

Reviews.Title: Very Useful
Reviews.Author: Aramat "Aramat"
Reviews.Content: We get more use from this than I would have ever expected.  I bought the two camera system and came to realize that another was needed to get all the angles.  It's a doggy cam these days.  We check in using the smart phone app, and it's very convenient.  I have been impressed by the battery life so far.  The camera gets daily use for at least 5 minutes, and it hasn't eaten through a set of batteries yet.  Resolution could be better, but probably not at the same price.  Setup was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Endless fun and peace of mind
Reviews.Author: Alvaro I. Mangual
Reviews.Content: We've only had these cameras for a few weeks (four for now), but my family loves them.  The cloud-based program that drives the cameras is dead-simple and reasonably priced for 2 gb of storage.  The camera itself is super light but tough.  We've dropped two from over six feet (butterfingers) and my cat's tossed one around for the better part of a day...no damage.  The video is on par with most basic web cams and if you set the resolution to full you actually get a great image, but no video...more like time-lapse photography.  But it stops motion well enough to read my brother-in-law's crazy t-shirts.Get one...get many!  Forget the wires unless you need bionic, Fort Knox style security.  People looking for that aren't on Amazon...are they?

Reviews.Title: Veuzone rocks!
Reviews.Author: S. Hayes "Sean the starved literate"
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the money. It connected easily and has a surprisingly long battery life. I bought it so my wife could watch our son (toddler...) because we have different shifts. My complaint might be in lowlight, it's grainy but daytime or full light, very good. I would buy this again for indoors.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product for Watching Our Pets
Reviews.Author: C. Bowers
Reviews.Content: We purchased this extra camera to go with our system which only had two cameras originally.  This camera does not have motion detection as our other two cameras but this is not a problem and they all work seamlessly together to cover the Great Room where our dogs play when we are not at home.  We do subscribe to the VueZone service in order to see the pets via my Iphone when we are in 4G (or 3G) areas.

Reviews.Title: Does it what it says, as long as cameras not too far away from router
Reviews.Author: KCinDC76
Reviews.Content: I've bought two of the VueZone systems, one for my home, and the other for an elderly parent.  I live in an apartment, so none of the cameras are very far from the VueZone router.  At my parent's home, however, I had to buy a very long ethernet cord, so that I could have the VueZone router in just the right place where all the cameras could communicate with the VueZone router.In terms of picture quality, the videos and pictures don't look great on a large monitor, but on a mobile phone, or even an iPad, they look fine.  Most important, I can see what I need to see.I'm willing to over-look the one negative I have about this system - the fact that the range is limited - for one reason.  I've tried other systems, and the problem is that my WiFi is unreliable, and the other camera systems connect through the WiFi.  The reason why this VueZone camera system works better for me is that it has its own router, which is connected to my router via Ethernet (not wirelessly). The communication between the cameras and the router seem to be flawless. While other WiFi devices in my home don't work well, this product does. For that reason alone I give it five stars - it does what it says it does.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up
Reviews.Author: WWTRAV
Reviews.Content: The camera is very simple to set up and functional, it was up and running within 10 minutes, however, the pictures come in fuzzy when there is motion. The cameras use a magnetic holder which tapes to the wall, there is a disclosure that this tape would destroy the wall or furniture, so it is something that should not be removed. The system comes with a trial period to store the videos then there is a $49.99 annual plan or a $99.99 annual plan and it does not need a computer or hard drive to store the information.  I have not decided to sign up for it at this time as long as only one or two areas that need to be viewed, the price is still reasonable, otherwise at almost $100.00 for each camera, the system cost will add up.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup and Good Recording
Reviews.Author: Android Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go along with the my VueZone system I purchased separately. The motion sensor and email alerts are great. And I like the online monitoring service they offer, too. This camera was very easy to setup. I was able to log in and view my house while I was on vacation using my Android phone. No issues to report!

Reviews.Title: My 4th vue-zone camera for my system
Reviews.Author: Randy M "rdm"
Reviews.Content: Added this as a 4th camera to my home system. At one time I had issues with the vue-zone web (needed to view your camera system) going down for maint or ???  Have not had their site down for some time now, so all is working very well. The camera system does have a bit choppy video but you still get live action video. Serves its purpose for live home monitoring. Video just is not as fluid as you might expect. But you would be able to see someone walking around, or monitor what the pets are up to. This 4th camera is further away from the base than is my other 3 cameras and a few times this 4th camera was not online. Probably due to the area and long distance it is placed away from the base. I may need to move this 4th camera to a different area in the room? Over all, this vue-zone is the most dependable system I have used. Many other cameras I have tried and rejected from D-link and Linksys constantly would drop offline and or freeze up, requiring a camera recycle (power on-off), which is not good when you are not at home. The vue-zone system is usually always dependable and available, as long as your home ISP is up and working and as long as the vue-zone web is not down for maint. The cameras are viewable using the vue-zone app for smart phones and iPhones. Works extremely well. I view my home cameras all the time on my phone when away from home. The battery lasts seemly FOREVER! Only the base station-receiver uses A/C power. The cameras are all battery so can be easily placed where needed. Small so they can be easily hidden on shelves and out of view, and thanks to the battery no-cord camera operation. This camera has motion sensor for motion detection to auto record when movement is detected and or sending you an email when motion was detected. Email can have attached snapped picture(s) or recorded video attached for viewing. All these features are custom user settable to suit needs, or notification can be turned off. Auto-record can be set on motion detection as well as snapping a photo(s). Video and photos stored under your account on the vue-zone web (which must be used to access your cameras). Vue-zone does charge a small fee, monthly or yearly terms for web access (needed for system-cameras operation). And vue-zone often offers savings promotions for accounts members. After first starting with month to month, I was soon offered yearly promotion plan for under $20, which naturally I jumped on that offer. Around holiday time, promotions for plans and savings on new cameras usually comes out weekly.

Reviews.Title: Useful as nanny cam
Reviews.Author: L Ma
Reviews.Content: As a reviewer put it, this product wouldn't be helpful as a security camera because1. the resolution is not high enough to get a usable image of your intruder unless up real close. Resolution is 320 or 640 (time lapse has 1600 but you'll be lucky to catch them at that exact moment its capturing).2. There is no night vision so you can forget about taking images after dawn or before dusk during which most home invasions occur.3. And even though you can adjust the sensitivity of the motion detection, the video capturing typically happens several seconds after the object that triggered the detection has moved. You would have to place the camera facing in the direction of motion and it would have to be at least 10 feet.It does however make a good nanny cam or daytime monitor (ie. monitoring the pool area or play area). Real benefit is1. monitoring remotely from any PC with internet connection.2. Cameras can be mounted virtually anywhere (indoor or outdoor) because there is no wires.3. Snapshots and video are stored online so you don't have to wait to come back to view images.There are other points but for the most part I wish they would make it optional to use your own setup (ie. web server) versus using their web portal.

Reviews.Title: VueZone Camera
Reviews.Author: silverado12775
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vue Zone system a couple of months ago, Worked great out of the box ,with little installation time, I have two camera's outside under the deck which work great in 0 degree weather, so I purchased this one for inside of my entry door, I can check my house inside and out daily from my work

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A. R. Baqer
Reviews.Content: My ISP firewall prevented this product from working properly as I was not able to connect to the server system

Reviews.Title: Poor performance, read on for details
Reviews.Author: HighTech
Reviews.Content: The cameras lack "Auto-Iris" which means you have to set the exposure daily as the sun comes up, or at nightfall.You can not "mask" areas (such as the street traffic).It eats batteries (a pair of CR123A) like candy at $7 a pair.It quite often loses sync and has to be restarted, does not tell you a camera has died (dead battery) and it falses like crazy.Distance from the base stations is limited, can only record ONE camera per base at a time...so when the camera over your driveway triggers, the other cameras go blind and you can NOT watch them remotely while this is happening. If you set the time to 90 seconds, you will receive a email..but cant watch it! There is NO SUPPORT for this device!! It has evolved to what it is and has reached a dead end. No improvements for the past year.It is subject to interference on the 2.4Ghz band, so if you place it near ANYTHING (like a baby monitor/Wireless LAN/cordless phone/wireless speaker/alarm system) you can bet it will cause you grief.The design is OLD (Jan 8,2011) and has not been updated.It is obsolete, Vuezone/Netgear knows this and has no intention of supporting this product.Cameras have improved a lot over the past 3 years. The people at Vuezone have been friendly, but this is not a "Surveillance" device by any means. It's fine for a "Doggy-Cam" but forget it as a home security device, a waste of money. We now use ours as a toy for our Pembroke Welsh Corgi...we toss or roll the camera and keep the videos from that playtime. Yes it's an expensive "ChewToy" but thats all it's good for.Repeated calls to Netgear/Vuezone has resulted in little assistance, product has never lived up to it's description, nor can it with the current firmware it uses in the cameras and base stations.Please realize this is a "Dead End" product and it is "what it is".I can't rate it lower than 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Useless
Reviews.Author: JEFF LEWIS
Reviews.Content: I was prewarned the image was less than clear. I thought how bad could it be. Well, it is terrible. The clarity is so poor it is impossible to identify whom I am looking at. This system should be prices as a toy and sold in Toys R Us.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Mr John P Griffin
Reviews.Content: This system works exactly as described. The key feature of the ViewZone system is the battery operation of the cameras, allowing huge flexibility in placement. I'm a fan and use five cameras at home. For this, the annual web-hosting fee is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Whats with the price on this one?
Reviews.Author: Jessie R.
Reviews.Content: Whats the difference between this one and the one that's $130?Is there any difference at all really ...? or....?

Reviews.Title: These cameras and the phone app is awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeff Henry
Reviews.Content: Great piece of mind to be able to look in on things when I am traveling from my iPhone or iPad.  The cameras are plug and play with the magnetic mounts anyone can do it.  I have 5 total cameras installed so I can see everything.  Since they run on camera batteries there were no wires to install.  My original cameras have gone over a year with on replacing the batteries.

Reviews.Title: like it, but wish it had the motion sensing
Reviews.Author: J. Edwards "TTUCPA"
Reviews.Content: bought it for inside. the difference is that this one does not have the motion sensing that the more expensive ones have

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: NDN RN
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with enough light. i am able to check on my house when I am not there, or my kids when I am in another part of the house.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed; couldn't get it to work.
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "On the Mississippi River"
Reviews.Content: Was never able to get it to work on a Fios system and after many technical calls to the company. sent back.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: leighrn
Reviews.Content: We added this system after a recent attempted break-in and love it. Easy to use and set up. Portable which is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: These are great too!
Reviews.Author: FREDERICK FRANZELLA
Reviews.Content: I have some of these cameras. Whats great about it you do not have to wait for movement they are always on. If you are going to have cameras you have to get a few of these.

Reviews.Title: I love vuezone
Reviews.Author: Xultar "Xultar"
Reviews.Content: The vuezone cameras aren't HD but they get the job done. I love the vuezone service. Motion detectors on the cameras will trigger system to text & email movement with a snapshot. They are wireless cameras & sync with system is just one button. I just wish Netgear didn't buy them.

Reviews.Title: I had issues with one of the camera that I purchased
Reviews.Author: mehdi Assadian
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased two cameras.  One of them worked fine, but the other one had issue.  When I put the battery in, it constatntly flickered.  I had to return it back, and so far, I have not heard back from the supplier

Reviews.Title: These cams work well
Reviews.Author: J. Carter
Reviews.Content: These cameras are very handy for a quick check of the house.  Since they run on battery they are not for  24x7 recording.  As long as that is not what you are looking for then these are perfect.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: BJF
Reviews.Content: This is one of those rare items that works perfectly and is simple to set-up. This combined with flawless Amazon service... wow and I am using it in my vacation house a continent away!

Reviews.Title: Be careful
Reviews.Author: Wayne Fox
Reviews.Content: The concept is good, but the performance is pretty poor.  Unless you have a small house and no wireless phones or internet, the range and dependability of these cameras is extremely poor.  a couple of walls and 300 feet becomes 30 feet.  One day a camera will be fine, the next I can't see it.It's nice some people find them OK, but they never work when I need them too.  I have to restart the gateway, restart cameras.  I'll admit my house is larger than most, but the furthest camera is only 50 feet away, and goes through maybe 3 walls (no floors), and it won't work most of the time.  I've switched the cameras around and the only ones that work are those that are within about 30 feet or more and only have 1 or 2 walls.I'll keep moving things to see if I can find some way to get them to work, but honestly I don't think they should be that sensitive to a wireless internet system.

Reviews.Title: welcome addition
Reviews.Author: Duffer
Reviews.Content: camera works as a add on.. easy to sync to running system.. look to add another camera. I told friends about it and they also like it.

Reviews.Title: I did not get my what I ask for
Reviews.Author: D. Simpkins "DavidPSimpkins"
Reviews.Content: I did not get my what I ask for! I pay for a Camera with a Motion Detection I got one that did not have that! I got my money back.

Reviews.Title: Bgdoc
Reviews.Author: drbob
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera less than month. Just checked  it remotely- no longer working! What now?  Two other cameras work fine. No motion sensing through glass is a problem.

Reviews.Title: These cameras a mid range to poor at best
Reviews.Author: J. "JBW"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a few issues.- If you don't close the program properly your camera will rundown the batter.- poor image quality- should not be used a security camera.  Image quaility is to poor.
